value.name: Reforming a Baltimore police department needs community buy-in and patience | COMMENTARY
value.description: Those leading police reform efforts under a federal consent decree in Baltimore need to make sure they are keeping the community informed.

value.name: Baltimore police leader urges reformers to move carefully
value.description: Baltimore City Police Commissioner Michael Harrison Wednesday cautioned that calls for defunding or dramatically reforming the police department need to be tempered with realistic expectations about how to maintain important services and improve public safety.

value.name: Baltimore Police Department Names First Black Woman Deputy Commissioner
value.description: On Thursday, Baltimore Police Commissioner Michael Harrison promoted Sheree Briscoe to the rank of Deputy Commissioner, Briscoe became the first African American woman to ascend to the rank of Deputy Commissioner with the Baltimore Police Department.

value.name: More Criminals Are Using ‘Ghost’ Guns To Commit Violent Crimes In Baltimore, Making It Difficult For Police To Trace
value.description: Baltimore earns the dubious distinction as one of the most violent cities in America. Each year, more than 300 people lose their lives in crimes in our city -- and increasingly those crime involve.

value.name: States lead charge on policing reform while Washington stalls: 'You have to move now'
value.description: Forty states and Washington, D.C., have enacted significant policing reform legislation, according to a group tracking them. Maryland is among those at the forefront.

video.name: As Congress debates police reform, some cities and states take action

value.name: Baltimore’s top cop sought out for consent decree advice, but some locally criticize cost and pace of reform
value.description: BALTIMORE — Baltimore Police Commissioner Michael Harrison has been getting calls from police chiefs around the country, seeking advice from a man who has helped steer two big-city departments through federal oversight.

value.name: Clay Travis and Buck Sexton to fill Rush Limbaugh's radio slot
value.description: The coveted radio slot left by the death of Rush Limbaugh has found its new voices in Clay Travis and Buck Sexton, Premiere Networks announced.

value.name: Baltimore Police Unveils Strategy To Advance Equity Within Department
value.description: The Department released what it calls its "Strategic Framework for Advancing Equity" in an announcement Tuesday morning.

value.name: Maryland expands Project Exile to get more illegal guns off Baltimore streets
value.description: There's a renewed push to get more illegal guns off the streets of Baltimore. The U.S. Attorney's Office of Maryland on Wednesday announced the expansion of the initiative known as Project Exile with the addition of three more local and federal prosecutors.

video.name: Project Exile expanded to get illegal guns off Baltimore streets

value.name: Baltimore law enforcement beefs up effort to bring gun cases to federal court, where punishment is harsher
value.description: With three more special prosecutors, the Project Exile unit in Baltimore grows to seven people. Officials call it a “force multiplier.”

value.name: Harrison adds songwriter to his resume
value.description: Michael Harrison recalled how he played the music of Gunhill Road when he was a disc jockey 50 years ago. Now the veteran broadcaster and publisher has helped to bring a new Gunhill Road song to life.

value.name: Police searching for hit-and-run suspect in Fountain Inn, victim's family seeks answers
value.description: The Fountain Inn Police Department is seeking information on a hit-and-run from May 15. According to the police department, between the hours of 11 p.m. and 12 a.m., a pedestrian was hit by a truck on McCarter Road near North Nelson Drive.

value.name: Valley group calling for police reform holds memorial service for George Floyd
value.description: Tuesday marks one year since the death of George Floyd, which sparked nationwide protests for police reform. On Tuesday afternoon, there was a memorial service in his honor in Youngstown.
